commits.body:
A terminal sought to browse the web,
But first it needed a thread to thread.
Now PDUs fly through socket wire,
"Opening..." echoes higher and higher—
The plumbing's done, CEF lies ahead.

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>
commits.author: Ryan X. Charles

commits.body:
The docs now tell of frames that wait,
No longer spinning, sealed to fate.
With diagrams and code displayed,
The rendering story fully conveyed.

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>
commits.author: Ryan X. Charles

commits.message: Add event-driven rendering to OSR example
commits.body:
The render loop once spun in vain,
Painting frames again and again.
Now CEF cries "Ready!"
We render steady—
No lag, no stutter, no pain.

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>
commits.author: Ryan X. Charles

commits.message: Remove fixed 16ms sleep from OSR event loop
commits.body:
The loop once slept a steady beat,
Sixteen milliseconds, bittersweet.
But input lagged and frames grew stale,
While users cursed this sluggish tale.
Now pump_app_events waits instead—
Wake on events, no sleepy dread!

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>
commits.author: Ryan X. Charles

commits.body:
The docs were lost in versions past,
With WKWebView holding fast.
But now they know the path we tread:
WezTerm and cef-rs lie ahead.
Each file now tells which version speaks,
So future readers won't spend weeks
Confused by code that's come and gone—
The documentation marches on!

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>
commits.author: Ryan X. Charles

commits.body:
Seven commits we made along the way,
From crashes dark to textures bright as day.
IOSurface learned to speak in proper types,
While context menus ceased their crashing bites.
Now written down so future selves may know
The battles fought to make the browser glow.

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>
commits.author: Ryan X. Charles

commits.body:
The docs were out of date, you see,
Still speaking of plans that used to be.
Now README, AGENTS, and cef.md align,
With validation results that truly shine.

- Create top-level README.md with project overview
- Update AGENTS.md with cef-rs validation status table
- Update docs/cef.md: status from "planned" to "validated"
- Mark Zig integration approach as historical

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>
commits.author: Ryan X. Charles

commits.message: Suppress context menu to prevent crash
commits.body:
A right-click once did bring,
The app unto its end.
NSApplication sought a thing
That winit could not lend.

Now we clear the menu model fast,
Before the menu shows—
The crash is fixed, the bug has passed,
And harmony now flows.
commits.author: Ryan X. Charles

commits.body:
Two browsers walked in parallel,
Each with textures to behold.
GitHub and Google side by side,
Though winit's loop was somewhat cold.

Per-instance TextureHolder stores each paint,
HashMap routes events by WindowId so quaint.
commits.author: Ryan X. Charles

commits.message: Tidy window config, note fullscreen woes
commits.body:
A window needs a name,
And size to call its own.
Fullscreen? Don't ask—
That path leads to despair,
So we left a note, and moved along.

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>
commits.author: Ryan X. Charles

commits.message: Add input handling to CEF OSR example
commits.body:
A browser window sits, still as stone,
No clicks, no keys, no life of its own.
Now mouse and keyboard speak to the frame,
And Chromium dances, no longer tame.

- Mouse: move, click, drag, scroll
- Keyboard: typing, arrows, delete
- macOS native key codes for proper input
- Clean shutdown without crash

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>
commits.author: Ryan X. Charles

commits.message: Fix purple flash on OSR startup
commits.body:
Before CEF paints its first frame,
Uninitialized memory took the blame.
Now we clear to black with care,
No more purple anywhere.

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>
commits.author: Ryan X. Charles

commits.message: Unify merge-upstream docs for all three repos
commits.body:
Three rivers flow into one stream,
Ghostty, WezTerm, cef-rs—a team.
One skill to merge them all,
One doc to heed the call.
Now upstream syncing's not so extreme.

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>
commits.author: Ryan X. Charles

commits.message: Fix macOS IOSurface texture import crash
commits.body:
The Metal API did reject transmutes' plea,
Crashing at address 0x1f00000080.
DeviceRef and TextureDescriptorRef—
Proper types, the objc Message decree.

Now textures flow from CEF to screen,
The purple fades, GitHub's page appears.

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>
commits.author: Ryan X. Charles

commits.message: Move cef-rs files to cef-rs/ folder for termsurf integration
commits.author: Ryan X. Charles

commits.message: Add unified .gitmodules for ts1/ and ts2/
commits.body:
Git submodules relocated with care,
To ts1/ and ts2/, both now there.
Freetype, harfbuzz, and more,
Now build from their new shore.

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>
commits.author: Ryan X. Charles

commits.message: Merge WezTerm as ts2/ for TermSurf 2.0
commits.body:
Two terminals, now side by side,
In ts1/ the Ghost does hide.
In ts2/ the Wez takes flight,
Cross-platform dreams within our sight.

Rust and Zig, a curious pair,
Each with features rich and rare.
Version two will blend them true—
A terminal-browser, fresh and new.

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>
commits.author: Ryan X. Charles

commits.message: Move all WezTerm files to ts2/
commits.author: Ryan X. Charles

commits.body:
The AGENTS.md now shows the way,
To ts1/ where Ghostty stays.
And .gitignore learned paths anew,
To track what builds, both old and true.

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>
commits.author: Ryan X. Charles

commits.message: Move Ghostty to ts1/ for TermSurf 2.0
commits.body:
The Ghostty files have packed their bags,
To ts1/ they now retreat.
Making room at root for WezTerm's flags,
Where Rust and CEF shall meet.

A fork of forks, both old and new,
Version one archived with care.
Version two will soon break through—
Cross-platform browser, fair and square.

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>
commits.author: Ryan X. Charles

commits.body:
The JSON files got fresh news to share,
Of version one-point-oh in the air.
New commits joined the log parade,
While older ones began to fade.
The website now knows what we've done—
TermSurf 1.0, the milestone's won!

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>
commits.author: Ryan X. Charles

commits.body:
We gazed across the Rust-y plains,
Where WezTerm meets Chromium's veins.
With wgpu both sides render bright,
CEF and terminal—a unified sight!
Cross-platform dreams no longer far,
When Rust becomes the guiding star.

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>
commits.author: Ryan X. Charles

commits.body:
From zero to one, the journey's complete,
A terminal browser, a surfing feat!
Through WebKit waves and iframe fights,
We've reached the shore of stable heights.
What started as a ghostly dream,
Now rides the web on Zig's own stream.

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>
commits.author: Ryan X. Charles

commits.body:
An iframe with dreams to be free,
Escaped to the main frame with glee.
We checked isMainFrame,
Put an end to its game—
Now OAuth stays where it should be.

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>
commits.author: Ryan X. Charles

commits.message: Add debug build script, tidy output paths
commits.body:
Two scripts now, a matching pair,
Debug and Release, each with care.
"Where did my .app go?" you'd once cry—
Now build/debug/ and build/release/ reply.

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>
commits.author: Ryan X. Charles

commits.body:
A link that says "open new window please!"
We load it in place with relative ease.
True tabs need shell escapes done right,
A security matter—worth the wait, not the fight.

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>
commits.author: Ryan X. Charles

commits.body:
The page now bends to your command,
Zoom in, zoom out, with keyboard hand.
Plus and minus, zero too—
Scale the web to perfect view.
A minor bump, a polished release,
Where documentation finds its peace.

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>
commits.author: Ryan X. Charles

commits.message: Update docs to reflect completed features
commits.body:
The checklist grew, the boxes filled,
With features built and bugs now stilled.
Camera, mic, and downloads too—
(Though cross-origin? That won't go through.)
From "notes to do" to "reference made,"
Our documentation's been upgraded.

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>
commits.author: Ryan X. Charles

commits.body:
cmd+plus and cmd+minus, a familiar pair,
Adjust the page with typographic flair.
Too small to read? Just zoom right in!
Too large for comfort? Make it thin.
And should you lose your sense of scale,
cmd+zero resets without fail.

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>
commits.author: Ryan X. Charles

commits.body:
Three guardians join the watch tonight:
Auth checks your name, Crash sets things right,
And Media asks before it peers
Through camera lens or listening ears.
The browser grows more wise and kind—
Security and grace combined!

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>
commits.author: Ryan X. Charles

commits.message: Add camera and microphone permission prompts
commits.body:
"May I see? May I hear?"
The website asks, drawing near.
A dialog appears, polite and clear:
"Allow" or "Don't"—the choice is here.
No silent spying, have no fear,
Your camera and mic need your cheer!

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>
commits.author: Ryan X. Charles

commits.body:
When WebKit falls and all goes white,
No longer shall you lose the fight.
A dialog rises from the void:
"Reload, or close what was destroyed?"
The phoenix option now appears—
Refresh the page, and dry your tears.

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>
commits.author: Ryan X. Charles

commits.body:
A site said "You cannot pass through!"
It demanded a name and word too.
Now a dialog appears,
Type credentials, no fears—
The bouncer steps aside, letting you view.

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>
commits.author: Ryan X. Charles

commits.body:
Downloads now descend from cloud to ground,
Through WebKit's gates, a path was found.
Blob URLs and same-origin flows,
NSSavePanel catches all that goes!

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>
commits.author: Ryan X. Charles

commits.body:
The browser pane longed to save,
Files it fetched from the wave.
With delegates in place,
And blobs we embrace,
Now downloads behave—no more knave!

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>
commits.author: Ryan X. Charles

commits.message: Smart file vs URL detection for web command
commits.body:
Type a filename, it opens the file,
Type a URL, it surfs in style.
localhost:3000 gets http:// prepended,
No more typing schemes—how splendid!

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>
commits.author: Ryan X. Charles

commits.body:
Upload your files with a click,
The picker appears, smooth and slick.
From photos to docs, big or small,
TermSurf now handles them all.
The version badge gleams on the site,
Another release done right!

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>
commits.author: Ryan X. Charles

commits.body:
A file picker springs to life,
When upload buttons end their strife.
Single, multiple, directory too—
Now TermSurf can upload for you.

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>
commits.author: Ryan X. Charles

commits.message: Move HTML tests to dedicated html folder
commits.body:
The test folder had a prior claim,
So HTML files needed a new name.
A folder called html, neat and clean,
For browser tests to call their scene.

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>
commits.author: Ryan X. Charles

commits.message: Fix version badge to not shift title
commits.body:
The badge once pushed the title aside,
Now absolute, it floats with pride.
Centered stays the name we know,
While version tags just tag along for show.

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>
commits.author: Ryan X. Charles

commits.message: Add version badge to website header
commits.body:
A tiny tag beside the name,
Proclaims the version's claim to fame.
So visitors can see at a glance,
If updates deserve a second chance.

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>
commits.author: Ryan X. Charles

commits.body:
The dialogs now speak from the page,
Alert, confirm, prompt take the stage.
With origin shown for your trust,
And spam suppression—a must!
TermSurf grows wiser with age.

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>
commits.author: Ryan X. Charles

commits.body:
A website once wanted to say,
"Hello!" in a modal display.
With alert, confirm, prompt—
Now TermSurf is prompt!
And spam? Just one click, go away.

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>
commits.author: Ryan X. Charles

commits.message: Add poetic commit messages to release skill
commits.body:
Releases deserve a verse or two,
A celebration long overdue.
Four to eight lines of wit and cheer,
To mark each milestone through the year.

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>
commits.author: Ryan X. Charles

commits.message: Shorten tagline, speed up TS builds
commits.body:
Less is more, the tagline's now tight,
And TypeScript compiles at the speed of light.
